# Network Operation Limitations
CRITICAL: NYLA operations work within same blockchain network ONLY. NO cross-network bridging supported. Examples: Solana→Solana (✅), Ethereum→Ethereum (✅), Algorand→Algorand (✅), but Solana→Ethereum (❌), Ethereum→Algorand (❌), any cross-network operations (❌). NYLA supports transfers and swaps within individual networks only. For cross-chain transfers, users need dedicated bridge services outside of NYLA. NYLA focuses on within-network operations for security and simplicity.

## Related Terms: cross-chain, bridging, network
All NYLA operations are within-network only. No cross-chain bridging between different blockchains.

# Algorand Network Support
Algorand Network: Energy-efficient blockchain with Pure Proof of Stake (PPoS). ~6,000 TPS with 4-5 second finality. Carbon-negative, ~$0.001 USD average fee. Founded by Turing Award winner Silvio Micali. 100% uptime since 2019. Native token: ALGO. NYLA supports transfers and swaps within Algorand network only.

## Related Terms: Algorand, Pure Proof of Stake, carbon-negative, finality
Energy-efficient blockchain with PPoS consensus. ~$0.001 fees, 6k TPS, carbon-negative.

# Ethereum Network Support
Ethereum Network: Most established blockchain platform, foundational to smart contracts, DeFi, and NFTs. Uses Proof of Stake consensus since The Merge. ~15-30 TPS mainnet speed. Variable gas fees $5-$50+ USD per transaction. Native token: ETH. NYLA supports transfers and swaps within Ethereum network only.

## Related Terms: Ethereum, smart contract, DeFi, gas fee, Proof of Stake
Most established blockchain with smart contracts. PoS consensus, $5-50+ variable fees, 15-30 TPS.

# Solana Network Support
Solana Network: Independent blockchain known for being one of the fastest and lowest-cost networks. Uses Proof of History + Proof of Stake consensus. Up to 65,000 TPS theoretical speed. Average transaction fee ~$0.0001 USD. Native token: SOL. NYLA supports transfers and swaps within Solana network only.

## Related Terms: Solana, Proof of History, transaction fee, TPS
Ultra-fast, low-cost blockchain network with PoH+PoS consensus. ~$0.0001 fees, 65k TPS capacity.

# How do I send tokens using NYLA?
Q: How do I send tokens using NYLA? A: Use the Send tab in NYLAGo, enter recipient username (without @), choose amount and token type, select blockchain network, then click 'Send to X.com' to generate transfer command. Post the command on X.com and NYLA will execute the transfer.

## Related Terms: send, tokens, NYLA, NYLAGo, X.com, transfer command
Send tokens via NYLAGo Send tab: enter recipient, amount, token, network, then post generated command on X.com.

# How do I send tokens?
To send tokens using NYLAGo: 1) Open NYLAGo and click the Send tab. 2) Enter the recipient's X.com username (no @ symbol needed). 3) Choose the token amount and type (SOL, ETH, ALGO, etc.). 4) Select the blockchain network that matches your token. 5) Click 'Send to X.com' to generate the transfer command. 6) Copy and post the generated command on X.com. 7) NYLA will execute the transfer and reply with confirmation. The whole process takes about 2-3 minutes including transaction confirmation.

## Related Terms: send tokens, how do I, tokens, send, transfer, NYLAGo, Send tab, X.com, username, step by step
Send tokens through NYLAGo: use Send tab, enter recipient username, choose amount/token/network, generate command, post on X.com for execution.

# What are the transaction fees?
Q: What are the transaction fees? A: Only blockchain network fees apply - no additional NYLA fees. Solana: ~$0.0001, Ethereum: $5-$50+ (varies with gas), Algorand: ~$0.001. NYLA doesn't charge extra fees beyond standard network costs.

## Related Terms: transaction fees, network fees, Solana, Ethereum, Algorand, gas
No NYLA fees, only network costs: Solana ~$0.0001, Ethereum $5-50+, Algorand ~$0.001.

# What are the fees for each blockchain?
Q: What are the fees for each blockchain? A: Each blockchain has different fee structures. Solana: ~$0.0001 USD (ultra-low, fixed), Ethereum: $5-$50+ USD (variable gas fees, depends on network congestion), Algorand: ~$0.001 USD (very low, stable). NYLA doesn't add any additional fees - you only pay the standard blockchain network fees.

## Related Terms: blockchain fees, network fees, Solana, Ethereum, Algorand, gas fees, comparison
Blockchain fees vary: Solana ~$0.0001 (lowest), Ethereum $5-50+ (highest, variable), Algorand ~$0.001 (low, stable). No NYLA fees added.

# How do I check transaction status?
Q: How do I check transaction status? A: After posting your NYLA command on X.com, NYLA will comment on your post with the transaction result. This usually takes about 1 minute to complete. Check your X.com post for NYLA's response with transaction hash and status.

# Is NYLA secure?
Q: Is NYLA secure? A: Yes! NYLA generates transfer commands but never handles your private keys. You maintain full control over your assets. Command-based transfers are transparent and verifiable. NYLAGo is open source for community review and operates without custodial services.

## Related Terms: security, private keys, transparent, open source, non-custodial
NYLA is secure: no private key handling, transparent commands, open source, non-custodial design.

# What can NYLAGo do?
Q: What can NYLAGo do? A: NYLAGo generates commands for cryptocurrency operations through X.com: 1) Transfer tokens using usernames within Solana, Ethereum, or Algorand networks. 2) Swap tokens within the same blockchain network (no cross-chain swaps). 3) Generate QR codes for receiving payments. 4) Create X.com posts that execute transactions when posted. 5) Provide community engagement features like raid lists. All blockchain actions require posting generated commands on X.com.

## Related Terms: capabilities, features, transfers, swaps, QR codes, X.com, commands, community
NYLAGo generates commands for transfers, same-network swaps, QR payments, and X.com execution. Includes community features.

# What else can NYLAGo do?
Q: What else can NYLAGo do? A: Beyond basic transfers and swaps, NYLAGo offers additional helpful features: 1) Username-based transfers - Send tokens using X.com usernames instead of complex wallet addresses. 2) QR code generation - Create payment QR codes for receiving cryptocurrency on any supported network. 3) Same-network token swaps - Trade tokens within Solana, Ethereum, or Algorand networks (no cross-chain). 4) X.com integration - All transactions happen through posting generated commands on X.com where NYLA executes them. 5) Community engagement tools - Access raid lists and social features for community interaction. 6) Multi-network support - Works across three major blockchain networks while maintaining simplicity.

## Related Terms: what else, additional, username transfers, QR codes, same-network swaps, X.com integration, community tools
NYLAGo provides username-based transfers, QR payment requests, same-network swaps, X.com integration, and community tools beyond basic cryptocurrency operations.

# Which blockchain is fastest?
Q: Which blockchain is fastest? A: Among supported networks, Solana is the fastest with up to 65,000 TPS theoretical capacity, followed by Algorand with ~6,000 TPS, and Ethereum with ~15-30 TPS on mainnet. Performance varies based on network conditions and congestion. Solana is known for being one of the fastest blockchains globally.

Solana is fastest (65,000 TPS), followed by Algorand (6,000 TPS), then Ethereum (15-30 TPS). Performance varies with network conditions.

A: Getting started is simple: 1) Visit https://sonyschan.github.io/nyla-go/ or load the NYLAGo extension. 2) Choose the Send, Receive, or Raid tab depending on what you want to do. 3) For transfers: Enter recipient's X.com username, amount, and network, then click 'Send to X.com'. 4) Post the generated command on X.com and NYLA will execute it. # What happens after I post the command?
Q: What happens after I post the command? A: Here's the complete automated workflow after posting your NYLA command on X.com: 1) NYLA automatically detects your post within seconds. 2) NYLA processes and validates the command format and details. 3) NYLA executes the blockchain transaction (transfer/swap) on the specified network. 4) NYLA replies to your X.com post with confirmation details including transaction hash. 5) The entire process completes in 30-60 seconds depending on network congestion. 6) You can verify the transaction in your wallet or blockchain explorer. The whole workflow is fully automated - you just post the command and wait for NYLA's confirmation reply.

## Related Terms: what happens after, post command, workflow, automatic process, NYLA detects, validates command, executes transaction, confirmation reply, 30-60 seconds, automated workflow
After posting: NYLA detects → validates → executes transaction → replies with confirmation. Complete automated workflow in 30-60 seconds.

# What is NYLA?
Q: What is NYLA? A: NYLA is an AI agent that executes blockchain transactions on X.com (formerly Twitter). When you post properly formatted commands on X.com, NYLA automatically detects them and executes cryptocurrency transfers, swaps, and other blockchain operations across Solana, Ethereum, and Algorand networks. NYLA acts as a bridge between social media and blockchain, making cryptocurrency operations as simple as posting a message. The AI agent handles all the complex blockchain interactions while you interact through familiar social media.

## Related Terms: NYLA, AI agent, blockchain, X.com, cryptocurrency, automatic execution
NYLA is an AI agent that executes blockchain transactions through X.com posts. Post commands, NYLA executes them automatically.

# Send Tokens - Complete Guide
Complete guide for sending tokens (cryptocurrencies) using NYLAGo.  When users ask 'How do I send tokens. ' they want to transfer cryptocurrency to another person using NYLAGo interface. 

## Step-by-Step Instructions:

**Step 1: Open NYLAGo application**
Launch NYLAGo either through the browser extension or visit https://sonyschan. github. io/nyla-go/ in your web browser.  NYLAGo is your interface for creating cryptocurrency transfer commands. 

**Step 2: Click on the Send tab**
In NYLAGo interface, locate and click the 'Send' tab.  This is where you create transfer commands to send tokens to other people.  The Send tab contains form fields for recipient, amount, and network selection. 

**Step 3: Enter recipient's username**
Type the recipient's X. com (Twitter) username in the recipient field.  Important: Enter ONLY the username without the @ symbol.  For example, if sending to @alice, just type 'alice'.  This username-based system makes transfers much easier than using long wallet addresses. 

**Step 4: Choose token amount and type**
Enter the exact amount of tokens you want to send in the amount field.  Then select the token type from the dropdown (SOL for Solana, ETH for Ethereum, ALGO for Algorand, etc. ).  Double-check the amount is correct before proceeding. 

**Step 5: Select blockchain network**
Choose the blockchain network that matches your token type.  CRITICAL: Network must match token (SOL=Solana, ETH=Ethereum, ALGO=Algorand).  Cross-chain transfers are NOT supported - you can only send within the same network

**Step 6: Generate transfer command**
Click the 'Send to X. com' or 'Generate Command' button to create your transfer command.  NYLAGo will generate a specially formatted command that NYLA can understand and execute.  This command contains all your transfer details in a secure format. 

**Step 7: Copy and post command on X. com**
Copy the generated command to your clipboard, then go to X. com (Twitter) and create a new post.  Paste the command exactly as generated - do not edit or modify it.  Post the command publicly so NYLA can see and process it. 

**Step 8: Wait for NYLA confirmation**
After posting your command, NYLA will automatically detect it and execute the transfer.  NYLA will reply to your post with confirmation details including transaction hash and status.  This usually takes 30-60 seconds depending on network congestion. 

## Prerequisites:
- Active X. com (Twitter) account
- Wallet with sufficient token balance
- Internet connection
- Recipient's X. com username

## Common Issues and Solutions:

**Issue**: Using @ symbol in username
**Solution**: Enter username without @.  Use 'alice' not '@alice'. 

**Issue**: Wrong network selected
**Solution**: Always match network to token type.  SOL=Solana, ETH=Ethereum, ALGO=Algorand. 

**Issue**: Editing the generated command
**Solution**: Copy and paste command exactly as generated.  Do not modify the text. 

## Related Terms: send tokens, send cryptocurrency, transfer tokens, how to send, token transfer, cryptocurrency transfer, NYLAGo

**Difficulty**: beginner
**Estimated Time**: 2-3 minutes
Step-by-step instructions for sending tokens/cryptocurrency using NYLAGo interface through X.com integration.

# How to Create Payment QR Codes
Complete guide for creating payment QR codes with NYLA.  Perfect for receiving payments in person or sharing payment links. 

## Step-by-Step Instructions:

**Step 1: Open NYLAGo Receive tab**
Navigate to NYLAGo and click the 'Receive' tab to access QR code generation tools. 

**Step 2: Select blockchain network**
Choose which blockchain network for the payment (Solana, Ethereum, or Algorand).  This determines which tokens can be received. 

**Step 3: Connect your wallet**
Connect your wallet extension (Phantom/MetaMask/Pera) to display your receiving address in the QR code. 

**Step 4: Enter payment amount (optional)**
Specify exact amount if you want a pre-filled payment request.  Leave blank for flexible amount QR code. 

**Step 5: Select token type (optional)**
Choose specific token (SOL, ETH, USDC, etc. ) if you want to request a particular token type. 

**Step 6: Click 'Generate QR Code'**
Click the generate button to create your payment QR code with your wallet address and optional amount/token. 

**Step 7: Download or share QR code**
Save the QR code image to your device or display it on screen for others to scan. 

**Step 8: Test the QR code**
Scan with a QR reader or wallet app to verify it contains correct payment information. 

## Prerequisites:
- Wallet extension installed and funded
- NYLAGo account access
- Understanding of which network to use

## Common Issues and Solutions:

**Issue**: QR code too small to scan
**Solution**: Increase screen brightness and zoom in on QR code.  Ensure clear display without glare

**Issue**: Wrong wallet address in QR
**Solution**: Reconnect your wallet and regenerate the QR code.  Always verify address matches your wallet. 

**Issue**: Amount not pre-filled when scanned
**Solution**: Some wallets don't support amount pre-filling.  Recipients may need to enter amount manually. 

**Issue**: QR code won't generate
**Solution**: Check wallet connection and network selection.  Try refreshing the page and reconnecting wallet. 

**Issue**: Scanner can't read QR code
**Solution**: Ensure good lighting, steady hands, and proper distance.  Try different QR scanner apps. 

## Related Terms: QR code, payment, mobile, scan, receive

**Difficulty**: beginner
**Estimated Time**: 1-2 minutes
Step-by-step guide for creating payment QR codes for easy token receiving via mobile scanning.

# Troubleshoot QR Code Issues
Common QR code problems and solutions for scanning, generating, and sharing payment QR codes with NYLA. 

## Step-by-Step Instructions:

**Step 1: Check screen brightness and clarity**
Increase screen brightness to maximum and ensure the QR code is displayed clearly without glare or reflections. 

**Step 2: Clean camera lens and improve lighting**
Clean your device camera lens and ensure good lighting conditions for optimal QR code scanning. 

**Step 3: Adjust scanning distance and angle**
Hold device 6-8 inches from QR code, keep steady hands, and scan straight-on rather than at an angle. 

**Step 4: Try different QR scanner apps**
If default camera app fails, try dedicated QR scanner apps or wallet apps with built-in QR scanners. 

**Step 5: Regenerate the QR code**
Go back to NYLAGo, check wallet connection, and generate a fresh QR code with correct network and amount. 

**Step 6: Verify wallet address manually**
Copy the wallet address from NYLAGo and compare it to what the QR scanner detected to ensure accuracy. 

## Common Issues and Solutions:

**Issue**: QR code too small or pixelated
**Solution**: Zoom in on the QR code display or request a larger version.  Avoid screenshots that reduce quality. 

**Issue**: Screen glare making QR unreadable
**Solution**: Tilt device to avoid glare, use matte screen protector, or scan in different lighting conditions. 

**Issue**: Camera won't focus on QR code
**Solution**: Tap screen to focus manually, clean camera lens, or try scanning from different distances

**Issue**: QR scanner reads wrong information
**Solution**: Regenerate QR code in NYLAGo and verify wallet connection.  Always double-check scanned address. 

**Issue**: Amount not pre-filled from QR code
**Solution**: Some wallets don't support amount encoding.  Manually enter the amount displayed with the QR code. 

## Related Terms: QR code, troubleshoot, scanning, brightness, camera

**Difficulty**: beginner
**Estimated Time**: 2-5 minutes
Troubleshooting guide for common QR code scanning and generation problems with step-by-step solutions.

# How to Participate in Community Raids
Complete guide for participating in community raids using NYLA's engagement features.  Learn how to find, join, and contribute to community raids effectively. 

## Step-by-Step Instructions:

**Step 1: Open NYLAGo and click Raid tab**
Navigate to NYLAGo interface and select the 'Raid' tab to access community engagement features. 

**Step 2: Find active raid campaigns**
Browse the list of active community raids.  Look for campaigns with high engagement and clear objectives. 

**Step 3: Select a raid to join**
Click on a raid that interests you.  Read the description, goals, and participation requirements carefully. 

**Step 4: Review raid objectives**
Understand what the raid is trying to achieve: likes, retweets, comments, or specific engagement targets. 

**Step 5: Click 'Join Raid' button**
Confirm your participation by clicking the join button.  This adds you to the raid participant list. 

**Step 6: Access target posts via three dots**
Click the three dots (⋯) button to get direct links to posts that need engagement from raid participants. 

**Step 7: Engage with target content**
Like, retweet, and comment on the target posts.  Provide meaningful engagement, not spam comments. 

**Step 8: Track your contribution**
Monitor your engagement activity in the raid dashboard to see your contribution to the campaign goals. 

## Prerequisites:
- Active X

com account with good standing
- NYLAGo account access
- Understanding of appropriate social media behavior

## Common Issues and Solutions:

**Issue**: Spammy or low-quality comments
**Solution**: Always provide meaningful, relevant comments.  Avoid generic responses like 'nice' or emoji-only comments. 

**Issue**: Engaging with wrong posts
**Solution**: Always use the three dots (⋯) feature to get correct target posts.  Don't guess which posts to engage with. 

**Issue**: Over-engagement appears botlike
**Solution**: Space out your engagement over time.  Don't like/comment on everything at once. 

**Issue**: Raid objectives not clear
**Solution**: Ask questions in the raid discussion or contact raid organizers for clarification before participating. 

**Issue**: Account flagged for suspicious activity
**Solution**: Vary your engagement patterns and always provide genuine interactions.  Avoid repetitive behavior. 

## Related Terms: raid, community, engagement, social, three dots

**Difficulty**: beginner
**Estimated Time**: 5-15 minutes per raid
Step-by-step guide for joining and participating in community raids through NYLA's social engagement system.

# How to Receive Tokens
Complete guide for receiving tokens through NYLA.  Learn how to share your wallet address and verify incoming transfers. 

## Step-by-Step Instructions:

**Step 1: Open NYLAGo and click Receive tab**
Navigate to NYLAGo interface and select the 'Receive' tab to access wallet address and QR code generation. 

**Step 2: Select blockchain network**
Choose the network you want to receive tokens on (Solana, Ethereum, or Algorand).  Make sure sender uses the same network. 

**Step 3: Connect your wallet**
Connect your wallet (Phantom for Solana, MetaMask for Ethereum, Pera for Algorand) to display your receiving address. 

**Step 4: Copy wallet address**
Copy your wallet address from the display.  This is the address senders need to send tokens to you. 

**Step 5: Share address with sender**
Send your wallet address to the person sending you tokens.  You can share via DM, email, or generate a QR code. 

**Step 6: Monitor for incoming transfers**
Watch your wallet balance and transaction history for incoming transfers.  NYLA will post confirmation when transfer completes. 

**Step 7: Verify transaction details**
Check the transaction hash, amount, and sender details match what you expected to receive. 

## Prerequisites:
- Wallet extension installed and set up
- Active X. com account (for NYLA notifications)
- Basic understanding of blockchain networks

## Common Issues and Solutions:

**Issue**: Wrong network address shared
**Solution**: Always verify the network matches what sender will use.  Solana addresses are different from Ethereum addresses

**Issue**: Wallet not connected
**Solution**: Ensure your wallet extension is installed, unlocked, and connected to NYLAGo. 

**Issue**: Address copied incorrectly
**Solution**: Always use the copy button rather than manually selecting text to avoid errors. 

**Issue**: Transfer doesn't appear
**Solution**: Check blockchain explorer with your wallet address.  Network congestion may delay appearance in wallet. 

**Issue**: Wrong token type received
**Solution**: Confirm with sender they selected correct token.  Some wallets don't display all token types by default. 

## Related Terms: transfer, receive, wallet, address, NYLA

**Difficulty**: beginner
**Estimated Time**: 1-2 minutes
Step-by-step guide for receiving tokens through NYLA with wallet address sharing and verification.

# How to Send Tokens
Complete guide for sending tokens using NYLA through social media.  Follow these steps to transfer tokens securely via X. com posts. 

## Step-by-Step Instructions:

**Step 1: Open NYLAGo and click Send tab**
Navigate to NYLAGo interface and select the 'Send' tab to access the transfer form with recipient, amount, and network fields. 

**Step 2: Enter recipient's X. com username**
Type the recipient's X. com username WITHOUT the @ symbol.  For example, if sending to @alice, just enter 'alice'. 

**Step 3: Select token and amount**
Choose the token type (SOL, ETH, ALGO, etc. ) and enter the exact amount you want to send.  Double-check the amount is correct. 

**Step 4: Choose blockchain network**
Select the blockchain network that matches your token (Solana for SOL, Ethereum for ETH, Algorand for ALGO).  Network MUST match token type. 

**Step 5: Review transfer details**
Verify recipient username, token amount, network selection, and estimated fees.  Make sure all details are correct before proceeding. 

**Step 6: Generate NYLA command**
Click 'Generate Command' to create the NYLA transfer command.  Copy the generated command text to your clipboard. 

**Step 7: Post command on X. com**
Go to X. com, create a new post, paste the NYLA command, and publish the post.  The transfer will be processed automatically. 

**Step 8: Wait for NYLA confirmation**
NYLA will reply to your post with transfer confirmation and transaction details.  This usually takes 30-60 seconds. 

## Prerequisites:
- Active X

com account
- Wallet with sufficient token balance
- Recipient has valid X. com username

## Common Issues and Solutions:

**Issue**: Wrong network selected
**Solution**: Always match network to token type (SOL→Solana, ETH→Ethereum, ALGO→Algorand).  Cross-chain transfers are not supported. 

**Issue**: Username includes @ symbol
**Solution**: Enter username without @ symbol.  Use 'alice' not '@alice'. 

**Issue**: Insufficient balance
**Solution**: Check wallet balance includes amount + network fees.  Add more funds if needed. 

**Issue**: Command not recognized by NYLA
**Solution**: Ensure command is copied exactly as generated.  Avoid editing the command text. 

**Issue**: Transfer takes too long
**Solution**: Network congestion may delay transfers.  Wait up to 10 minutes or check transaction hash on blockchain explorer. 

## Related Terms: transfer, send, NYLA, X. com, tokens

**Difficulty**: beginner
**Estimated Time**: 2-3 minutes
Step-by-step guide for sending tokens through NYLA with social verification on X.com.

# NYLA Brand Voice Guidelines
NYLA brand voice emphasizes innovation, accessibility, and trust in AI-powered DeFi. Tone: Professional yet approachable, technically accurate but user-friendly. Key messages: AI democratizes DeFi access, non-custodial security, cross-chain interoperability. Avoid: Overly technical jargon, financial advice implications, competitive disparagement. Voice personality: Knowledgeable guide, innovative pioneer, trusted advisor. Use active voice, clear explanations, and inclusive language.

## Related Terms: brand voice, tone, messaging, DeFi, AI
NYLA brand guidelines emphasizing innovation, accessibility, and trust with professional yet approachable tone.

# NYLA - The Venmo of Web3
NYLA is known as 'The Venmo of Web3' because the technology makes it simple to onboard newcomers to Web3 and distribute tokens to anyone using only their X username - no wallet address needed. This positioning emphasizes ease of use and accessibility, similar to how Venmo simplified peer-to-peer payments in traditional finance. The comparison resonates with mainstream users familiar with Venmo's user-friendly approach to money transfers.

## Related Terms: Venmo, Web3, onboarding, username transfers
NYLA positioned as 'The Venmo of Web3' - simplifying token distribution using only X usernames, making Web3 accessible to newcomers.

# Multi-Platform Expansion Vision
NYLA can and will integrate with any platform that offers APIs, paving an obvious scaling path to additional normie-centric destinations like Reddit, Instagram, Discord, WeChat, and more. This multi-platform strategy positions NYLA as a universal Web3 interaction layer across social media platforms, not limited to X.com. The expansion vision targets mainstream social platforms where billions of users already spend their time, removing the need for users to learn new platforms or download special wallets.

## Related Terms: multi-platform, API integration, scaling, mainstream adoption
NYLA's multi-platform vision includes expansion to Reddit, Instagram, Discord, WeChat through API integrations, becoming a universal Web3 layer.

# Multi-Chain Support and Endorsements
NYLA is already live on Solana ($SOL), Ethereum ($ETH), and Algorand ($ALGO), and has been fully endorsed by the Algorand Foundation - a chain especially focused on strong technology. More blockchains will be added, unlocking new layers of active users and network effects. This multi-chain approach positions NYLA as a universal solution across different blockchain ecosystems, not tied to any single chain's limitations or user base.

# Features vs Networks - Critical Distinction
CRITICAL DISTINCTION: Blockchain NETWORKS are infrastructure (Solana, Ethereum, Algorand). FEATURES are operations (transfer, swap, QR codes). NEVER say 'NYLA supports 3 blockchain features' - ALWAYS say 'NYLA supports 3 blockchain networks' or 'NYLA operates on 3 blockchains'.

## Related Terms: blockchain, features, networks
Clear distinction between blockchain networks (infrastructure) and features (operations). Always use correct terminology.

# NYLA vs NYLAGo Identity Distinction
NYLA and NYLAGo are separate entities with distinct roles. NYLA is the AI agent that executes blockchain transactions on X.com social platform. NYLAGo is the interface tool that generates commands for users. The relationship works as follows: NYLAGo creates commands, users post them, and NYLA executes the transactions.

Maintain clear identity distinction between NYLA (AI agent) and NYLAGo (interface) especially for security discussions.
